intro: Reseda stenobotrys, commonly known as narrow-leaved reseda, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many showy flowers with colorful blooms. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and it produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or white. Reseda stenobotrys is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
